title: Top Trade Solutions Firm Curve Commercial Names Lily Tapia as New CEO
text:
Lily’s expertise and leadership will serve as pivotal assets for our clients and enhance our company’s next phase of growth and expansion. Miramar, FL (PRWEB) July 22, 2015
Curve Commercial , one of the nation’s leading independent supply chain solutions corporations, today announced Lily Tapia as the company’s new CEO. Tapia will take over the reins of the day-to-day operations from former CEO Daryl Hudson who will now serve as Curve Commercial’s Chairman of the Board.
Tapia has a proven track record of delivering outstanding results while providing financial services and strategic solutions to companies of various sizes. Prior to joining Curve Commercial, she worked as Director and Senior Vice President in the Enterprise Client Coverage group of Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Tapia was a top producer at Merrill Lynch, earning multiple awards and distinctions for performance, leadership and strategic growth.
“I am excited to be joining Curve Commercial’s highly talented team,” said Tapia. “As an innovative company that provides critical solutions for fast-growing companies, Curve is able to make a meaningful impact at pivotal times in its clients’ life cycles. The difference we make is remarkable. Privately owned, small to mid-sized businesses fuel the growth of the U.S. economy, create jobs, and allow the pursuit of the American Dream. I love being a part of that process.”
Curve’s Former CEO and Chairman of the Board Daryl Hudson added: “Lily Tapia is an extremely talented and experienced top level executive. We are very proud to welcome her to head up our growing team. Lily’s expertise and leadership will serve as pivotal assets for our clients and enhance our company’s next phase of growth and expansion.”
About Curve Commercial:
Curve Commercial Services LLC is an inventory procurement company which provides unique working capital solutions to rapidly growing businesses by extending a cash flow bridge between inventory purchases, and conversion of resulting receivables. Manufacturers, distributors and retailers can all benefit from Curve’s services, which do not compete with, but complement and enhance existing lending arrangements with banks and other financial institutions. Learn more at http://curvecommercial.com/ .
